Name: Word
First Dolch: Sentences

Name: after
First Dolch: We went to play after lunch.^She washed her hands after eating.^After the rain

Name: again
First Dolch: Can you say that again?^I want to try again.^He ran again to the park.

Name: an
First Dolch: I saw an owl.^She ate an apple.^He found an old coin.

Name: any
First Dolch: Do you have any candy?^I donâ€™t want any juice.^Take any book you like.

Name: ask
First Dolch: Please ask a question.^I will ask for help.^She asked him nicely.

Name: as
First Dolch: He is as tall as his brother.^Run as fast as you can.^She sings as well as her friend.

Name: by
First Dolch: We went by the river.^The book was written by her.^He stood by the door.

Name: could
First Dolch: Could you help me?^She could jump high.^I could see the stars.

Name: every
First Dolch: Every day is sunny.^I see him every morning.^Every child smiled.

Name: fly
First Dolch: Birds fly in the sky.^Can you fly a kite?^The plane will fly soon.

Name: from
First Dolch: I got a gift from her.^He walked from school.^The letter came from my friend.

Name: give
First Dolch: Please give me the pen.^She will give a gift.^I want to give a hug.

Name: going
First Dolch: We are going to the park.^She is going to help.^They are going to school.

Name: had
First Dolch: He had a red ball.^I had fun today.^She had a nice day.

Name: has
First Dolch: She has a dog.^He has a blue hat.^My friend has a toy.

Name: her
First Dolch: This is her book.^I saw her yesterday.^Give it to her.

Name: him
First Dolch: I saw him run.^She talked to him.^Give the toy to him.

Name: his
First Dolch: His dog is big.^I like his hat.^He lost his pencil.

Name: how
First Dolch: How are you?^Show me how to do it.^I know how to help.

Name: just
First Dolch: She just arrived.^I just finished my homework.^He just laughed.

Name: know
First Dolch: Do you know the answer?^I know him well.^She wants to know more.

Name: let
First Dolch: Let us play.^Please let me go.^Let him try.

Name: live
First Dolch: I live in a house.^Birds live in trees.^We live happily.

Name: may
First Dolch: May I help you?^You may sit here.^It may rain today.

Name: of
First Dolch: A cup of water.^He is a friend of mine.^The cover of the book is blue.

Name: old
First Dolch: My old shoes are here.^She has an old doll.^He is an old man.

Name: once
First Dolch: Once upon a time.^I have seen this once.^Once we went there together.

Name: open
First Dolch: Open the door.^Please open your book.^She can open the box.

Name: over
First Dolch: Jump over the fence.^Look over there.^The plane flew over the city.

Name: put
First Dolch: Put the toy down.^I will put it here.^She put her coat on.

Name: round
First Dolch: The ball is round.^We ran round the park.^Draw a round shape.

Name: some
First Dolch: I have some pencils.^Can I have some cake?^Some birds are flying.

Name: stop
First Dolch: Stop running.^Please stop talking.^He said stop.

Name: take
First Dolch: Take this book.^I will take a cookie.^She wants to take a nap.

Name: thank
First Dolch: Thank you for helping.^I said thank you.^We should thank him.

Name: them
First Dolch: Give them the toys.^I saw them yesterday.^She called them.

Name: then
First Dolch: We ate lunch and then played.^I went there then.^He said hello and then left.

Name: think
First Dolch: I think it is fun.^She will think about it.^I think you are right.

Name: walk
First Dolch: We walk to school.^He likes to walk.^She will walk with us.

Name: were
First Dolch: They were happy.^We were there yesterday.^The dogs were loud.

Name: when
First Dolch: When will you come?^I know when to start.^She asked when it will end.
